abstract: The unit was sold for $10.3 billion to a group of private equity firms that will take an equal stake in the company.
snippet: The unit was sold for $10.3 billion to a group of private equity firms that will take an equal stake in the company.
lead_paragraph: Home Depot agreed today to sell its Home Depot Supply Unit to a group of private equity firms for more than $10.3 billion. Members of the consortium — Bain Capital, the Carlyle Group and Clayton, Dubilier & Rice — will take an equal stake in the company.

headline.main: Home Depot Agrees to Sell Supply Unit

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Michael J. de la Merced
